results.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage
results.brief_description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. These powerful stories examine the complexities of the condition ‘ the losses, the adjustments and the need to move forward ‘ preserving the spirit of the families involved and creating life long tributes to personal achievement.
results.description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. results.title: Simmo, the man I love
results.brief_description: John’s reputation as a great pilot earned him the respect of his colleagues, especially one admirer, Yolanta. But towards the end of his career, it felt like he was losing his touch, something was wrong. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Passionate pursuits
results.brief_description: This story was created for Robin Hodder’s grandchildren to celebrate his extraordinary achievements as an Olympic sportsman, a husband of 38 years and the world’s greatest dad. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Max and Noel Oliver's story
results.brief_description:
Alzheimer’s sufferer Max together with his wife Noel have told a story for their granddaughters that celebrates their life together as well as capturing Max’s memories of his son, the children’s father, who died when they were very young. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Carmel: storyteller
results.brief_description: Carmel is a retired school teacher, wife, mother and grandmother. Her family’ s life dramatically changed when she was diagnosed with early onset memory loss. With her husband, she tells their story and looks positively in the face of an unknown future. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Pride and diversity
results.brief_description: ‘Pride and Diversity’ was a program of digital storytelling workshops with multiple groups focussed on community issues and cultural diversity. In partnership with VicHealth, City of Stonington, City of Melbourne, Kensington Association, Kensington Women’s Dinner, Kensington Storytelling Festival ‘ community storytellers, Quiksound Productions- City of Monash FReeZA committee, Minus 18, Inside Out Group, Pride & Diversity group- Monash Youth & Family Services, Roleplay, Soundslike ‘ City of Stonington’s FreeZA committee, Go Girl Go, Young Mum’s program, The Club, Girls Own - YWCA

results.title: The Sound of Hip Hop
results.brief_description: Karim, a music teacher who works in Kensington with African youth, relates how he first discovered Hip Hop and started his love affair with music. Created as part of the ‘Kensington Stories’ ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the Kensington Storytelling Festival and in partnership with VicHealth.
